result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhusshon Granville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, victimwitness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and DNA surcharge, supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during probation peroid or civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Ivy D. witihout prior Court approval. Third party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfuly complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recomended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Probation review hearing to be requested by agent.
48USC Section 922 (g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhusshon Granville

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rhusshon Granville in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Rhusshon Granville in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.   The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT #3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, with credit for 205 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: :
* 60 Condition days stayed pending review hearing.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Ivy D. 
   without prior court approval.  
* 3rd party contact for the purpose of time 
   with children as approved by agent.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and DNA surcharge, supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero. 
**PROBATION REVIEW HEARING TO BE REQUESTED BY AGENT. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.   
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Rhusshon Granville not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Due to branch 4 in trial, case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in branch 4 on 11-7-2014 at 1:30 pm. mld

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Rhusshon Granville not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Due to branch 4 in trial with ADA Nicholas Heitman, Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 4 on 10-23-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Rhusshon Granville in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Rhusshon Granville in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1 and #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the weapon enhancer dismissed on COUNT #3. 

 AS TO COUNT #3 (w/o the weapon enhancer), defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 10-15-2014 at 8:30 am.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 10-13-2014 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.

Attorney Jeremy C. Evans in court for Attorney Matt Last, defendant Rhusshon Granville not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 The Hon. Dennis Flynn for the Hon. Mel Flanagan.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  Case remains calendared for Motion Hearing in Branch 4 on 9-25-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 10-13-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

for Bail Reduction for Modification, received and filed.
--Bail / Bond Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 on 9-8-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Rhusshon Granville in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Rhusshon Granville in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Due to the unavailability of defense counsel next week, and his need for further investigation, Attorney Last will not be prepared to proceed to trial on 7-28-2014.  Demand for Speedy Trial was entered by defense on 4-30-2014.  Upon questioning by the Court, the defendant does agree to adjourn the date of trial.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial was re-entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Hearing on Other Acts Motion, (State and defense), on 9-25-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 10-13-2014 at 8:30 am.  Any supplements to motions, must be filed one week prior to the hearing, per the Court.   mld

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Rhusshon Granville not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Based upon additional investigation, defense is requesting a new date for trial.  Case adjourned for Hearing on Defense Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial (Speedy), scheduled in Branch 4 on 7-17-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Case remains calendred for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-28-2014 at 8:30 am. 
 *** DEFENDANT TO BE PRODUCED FOR NEXT COURT DATE, PER THE COURT.   mld

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Rhusshon Granville not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Status Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-15-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-28-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Rhusshon Granville not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant was not produced from the House of Correction.  Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Defense counsel previously represented the victim on this case on another matter, and therefore, will need to withdraw as counsel.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw is heard granted by the Court.  Attorney Liggins will inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 7-8-2014 at 8:30 am.  The Court maintains the Jury Trial date of 7-28-2014 at 8:30 am, branch 4.   mld
to Admit Other Acts, from the State, received and filed.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug Testing, Breathalyzer Tests, Absolute Sobriety and No Weapons.  Absolutely No Release From Home (24 hour curfew).  mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.   mld

Defendant Rhusshon Granville in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Rhusshon Granville in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Amended Complaint was filed.  Defendant pled not guilty to misdemeanor counts #2 and #3.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Officer Drucilla Schneider.  State rests. Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty as to count #1.  Discovery, offer and Discovery Demand turned over to defense by the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-26-2014 at 1:30 pm and Jury Trial on 7-28-2014 at 8:30 am.    mld

received and filed.

COUNT #2: MISDEMEANOR BATTERY, DOMESTIC ABUSE REPEATER, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes secition(s) 940.19(1), 968.075(1)(a) and 939.62(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.   mld

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ivy D. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rhusshon Granville in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Rhusshon Granville in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defense moves to dismiss the repeater penalty enhancer. Arguments heard. State moves to amend the complaint. Defense objects to the amendment. Court dismisses the repeater enhancers on COUNT 2. No plea is taken at this time for the misdemeanor count as the Court will allow the State time to amend the complaint. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
